title: Compiler flags have a random order
body:
When using python 3, flags randomised at build time resulting in multiple installs based on all possible combinations of multiple flags - issue arose as Ubuntu 18.04 doesn't include python2 in a base image.

### Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Not necessary on ubuntu 18.04 - but necessary on SLES 12 SP3 
vim \`which spack\`
change:
#!/usr/bin/env python
to
#!/usr/bin/env python3

2. modify compilers.yaml
spack config --scope defaults edit compilers
#### modify gcc/default entry with e.g.
    flags:
       cppflags: -fPIC -mtune=native
       cflags: -fPIC -mtune=native
       cxxflags: -fPIC -mtune=native
       fflags: -fPIC -mtune=native
       ldflags: -fPIC -Wl,--as-needed

#### install a package multiple times - e.g. more than 4 times in the above
for i in \`seq 1 10\` ; do spack install zlib; done

#### expected results - 1 install, 9 already installed messages
#### actual results - 4 installs of packages with different concretizations based on order of flags (easiest show by uninstall I think):

### Error Message

spack uninstall --all zlib
==> The following packages will be uninstalled:

    -- linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 / gcc@7.3.0 -------------------------
    fj6ajxq zlib@1.2.11%gcc cflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" cppflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" cxxflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" fflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" ldflags="-Wl,--as-needed -fPIC" +optimize+pic+shared
    h227bca zlib@1.2.11%gcc cflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" cppflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" cxxflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" fflags="-fPIC -mtune=native" ldflags="-fPIC -Wl,--as-needed" +optimize+pic+shared
    gbbmeio zlib@1.2.11%gcc cflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" cppflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" cxxflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" fflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" ldflags="-Wl,--as-needed -fPIC" +optimize+pic+shared
    qn3j54v zlib@1.2.11%gcc cflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" cppflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" cxxflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" fflags="-mtune=native -fPIC" ldflags="-fPIC -Wl,--as-needed" +optimize+pic+shared
==> Do you want to proceed? [y/N] 

### Information on your system

tested on:
spack 0.11.2 and 0.12.0
Ubuntu 18.04 - python 3.6.7
SLES 12 SP3 - python/3.5.1 python/3.6.1
Also SLES 12 SP3 - python/2.7.13 where everything works as expected.
